definition: To go through a process or a series of stages, typically involving a progression or completion of tasks, actions, or events. It is commonly used to describe the act of passing through or completing a course, program, or a set of steps in a systematic manner.

examples.german: Ich habe das ganze Buch durchlaufen.
examples.english: I have gone through the entire book.
The river passes through several cities.

examples.german: Er musste eine lange Ausbildung durchlaufen.
examples.english: He had to go through a long training.

examples.german: Das Projekt hat verschiedene Phasen durchlaufen.
examples.english: The project has gone through various phases.

examples.german: Die Idee wurde von vielen Kritikern durchlaufen.
examples.english: The idea was scrutinized by many critics.
